page.title: 01RAMSGATE
page.content: Ramsgate rose from being a small fishing port to being a popular holiday resort.Like all British resorts, the town has declined in popularity.People still come here to work as there are several large industrial sites around. Visitors still mainly come here from London as they have always done,but the number of places of entertainment has dropped.The Royal Harbour still attracts many yachtsmen and the area beyond the harbour is being developed by the Sally Line.The town is easily accessible by road,rail,sea & air. The education system is still based on selection at 11.The large shopping area has large & small shops.The climate is a very pleasant one,due to the southern aspect and proximity of the Continent. The crime rate is low and the detection rate is good.The new bypass road and harbour extension should help the town.
